pr_title: Avro: support writing SMALLINT to Avro

timeline.message:
Avro: support writing SMALLINT to Avro

The Postgres/GPDB type SMALLINT has no corresponding Avro type[0].

In this commit we make SMALLINT types being written to Avro external
sources appear as Avro integer type. For reading Avro data, the
Greenplum external table should always use INT or BIGINT.

[0] https://avro.apache.org/docs/current/spec.html#schema_primitive

Authored-by: Oliver Albertini <oalbertini@vmware.com>

timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText:
With just the single cast, the editor warns of redundant cast. An alternative is this if you prefer:
field.val = ((Short) field.val).intValue();
replies.author: oliverralbertini

replies.bodyText: I think it's fine to keep it as is
replies.author: frankgh

replies.bodyText:
To expand on this a bit, when just using (Integer) field.val or (int) field.val I see this error when the writable table has SMALLINT type:
type  Exception report   message   java.lang.Short cannot be cast to java.lang.Integer
When casting between primitive types the above should work fine, but with reference types (I think) you need to cast twice in order to affect the underlying data (cast of a reference just changes the reference, not the data itself).
